title: Better Hypothesis Testing for Statistical Machine Translation: Controlling for Optimizer Instability
descriptions: This study investigates the impact of optimizer instability on statistical machine translation results. It demonstrates that optimizer instability can lead to incorrect conclusions about experimental manipulations and proposes a method to control for this variable using multiple replications of the optimization procedure. The results show that even a small number of replications can significantly improve the reliability of the results, and the authors suggest best practices for significance testing in machine translation research.
